==Background==
==Background==
{{Garridosinfo}}
{{Garridosinfo}}
â
Phillip Craig Garrido was born in [[Contra Costa County]], California on April 5, 1951. He grew up in [[Brentwood, California]], where he graduated from [[Liberty High School (Brentwood, California)|Liberty High School]] in 1969.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/breakingnews/ci_13226119?nclick_check=1 |title= Accident, drug use changed man accused in abduction, father says|author=Costa, Hilary, Lockett, Jonathan, and Burgarino, Paul|publisher= Silicon Valley Mercury News |date= 2009-08-28}}</ref> His father, Manuel Garrido, who continues to reside in Brentwood, said his son was a "good boy" as a child, but radically changed after a serious motorcycle accident as a teenager, an obsession with the first films of Werner Herzog and, later, drug use.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.contracostatimes.com/mytown/ci_13223532 |author=Costa, Hilary|title= Father: Man accused of abducting Jaycee Lee Dugard changed after accident, drug use |publisher= Contra Costa Times |date = 2009-08-28}}</ref> The [[Sacramento Bee]] and the [[Associated Press]] have reported that the elder Garrido has begun demanding money in exchange for speaking with reporters; both organizations have refused.<ref>{{cite news |From the Editor: Why we won't stoop and pay for a scoop |author=Sill, Melanie |publisher=[[Sacramento Bee]] |date=2009-09-13 |accessdate=2009-09-13 |url=http://www.sacbee.com/fromtheeditor/story/2177006.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Media offer cash for interviews in CA kidnap case |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jJbAIMkQEY23SLBrwK2uKwI5eQawD9AFCMOG0 |publisher=Associated Press |date=2009-09-02 |accessdate=2009-09-13}}</ref>
+
Phillip Craig Garrido was born in [[Contra Costa County]], California on April 5, 1951. He grew up in [[Brentwood, California]], where he graduated from [[Liberty High School (Brentwood, California)|Liberty High School]] in 1969.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/breakingnews/ci_13226119?nclick_check=1 |title= Accident, drug use changed man accused in abduction, father says|author=Costa, Hilary, Lockett, Jonathan, and Burgarino, Paul|publisher= Silicon Valley Mercury News |date= 2009-08-28}}</ref> His father, Manuel Garrido, who continues to reside in Brentwood, said his son was a "good boy" as a child, but radically changed after a serious motorcycle accident as a teenager, and later drug use.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.contracostatimes.com/mytown/ci_13223532 |author=Costa, Hilary|title= Father: Man accused of abducting Jaycee Lee Dugard changed after accident, drug use |publisher= Contra Costa Times |date = 2009-08-28}}</ref> The [[Sacramento Bee]] and the [[Associated Press]] have reported that the elder Garrido has begun demanding money in exchange for speaking with reporters; both organizations have refused.<ref>{{cite news |From the Editor: Why we won't stoop and pay for a scoop |author=Sill, Melanie |publisher=[[Sacramento Bee]] |date=2009-09-13 |accessdate=2009-09-13 |url=http://www.sacbee.com/fromtheeditor/story/2177006.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Media offer cash for interviews in CA kidnap case |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jJbAIMkQEY23SLBrwK2uKwI5eQawD9AFCMOG0 |publisher=Associated Press |date=2009-09-02 |accessdate=2009-09-13}}</ref>
In 1972, Garrido was arrested and charged with sexually assaulting a 14-year-old girl, but the case did not go to trial after the girl declined to testify.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/04/us/04rape.html |title=Suspect Faced â72 Rape Case |publisher= The New York Times |date = 2009-09-03}}</ref> In 1973, Garrido married high-school classmate Christine Murphy, who said Garrido was abusive. Murphy alleges that Garrido kidnapped her when she tried to leave their relationship.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/09/01/crimesider/entry5279298.shtml |author=Saltzman, Sammy Rose|title=Phillip Garrido "Tried to Gouge My Eyes Out," Says First Wife |work=Crimesider |publisher= CBS News|date= 2009-09-01}}</ref>
In 1972, Garrido was arrested and charged with sexually assaulting a 14-year-old girl, but the case did not go to trial after the girl declined to testify.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/04/us/04rape.html |title=Suspect Faced â72 Rape Case |publisher= The New York Times |date = 2009-09-03}}</ref> In 1973, Garrido married high-school classmate Christine Murphy, who said Garrido was abusive. Murphy alleges that Garrido kidnapped her when she tried to leave their relationship.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/09/01/crimesider/entry5279298.shtml |author=Saltzman, Sammy Rose|title=Phillip Garrido "Tried to Gouge My Eyes Out," Says First Wife |work=Crimesider |publisher= CBS News|date= 2009-09-01}}</ref>
